metadata.title: CVE-2019-19721 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
An off-by-one error in the DecodeBlock function in codec/sdl_image.c in VideoLAN VLC media player before 3.0.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via a crafted image file. NOTE: this may be related to the SDL_Image product.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.17.4-5
libvlc5 - 3.0.17.4-5
libvlccore9 - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-bin - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-data - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-l10n - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.17.4-5
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.17.4-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.17.4-5').
